DataElement.preferredName: Bone Metastasis Less Than Specified Maximum Dimension Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to the magnitude of metastatic bone tissue in the largest measured direction relative to an indicated value or measurement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bone Metastasis Less Than Specified Maximum Dimension
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the magnitude of metastatic bone tissue in the largest measured direction relative to an indicated value or measurement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Bone; a rigid connective tissue that makes up the skeleton of vertebrates.:Cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ. For example, breast cancer cells may spread (metastasize) to the lungs and cause the growth of a new tumor. When this happens, the disease is called metastatic breast cancer.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.

Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:Clearly and explicitly stated.:the largest possible quantity or degree.:The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
The largest possible quantity or degree.
The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.
